params.taskDescription:
If a triangle is a right triangle, then it does not have one 90-degree angle or <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <msup>
      <mi>a</mi>
      <mn>2</mn>
    </msup>
  </mrow>
  <mo>+</mo>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <msup>
      <mi>b</mi>
      <mn>2</mn>
    </msup>
  </mrow>
  <mo>=</mo>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <msup>
      <mi>c</mi>
      <mn>2</mn>
    </msup>
  </mrow>
  <mo>.</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">{a^2} + {b^2} = {c^2}.</annotation></semantics></math>

params.taskDescription:
The triangle is a right triangle, or a right triangle does not have a 90-degree angle, if and only if it is not the case that the longest side of a triangle is <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>c</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">c</annotation></semantics></math> implies <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>a</mi>
  <mo>+</mo>
  <mi>b</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">a + b</annotation></semantics></math> must be <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mo>></mo>
  <mi>c</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">> c</annotation></semantics></math>.
